question: Which of the following best describes the purpose of the Area Under the Curve (AUC) in the context of an ROC curve?

options.A: To measure the number of false positives generated by a binary classification model.
options.B: To quantify the overall performance of a binary classification model by measuring the entire area under the curve.
options.C: To determine the optimal classification threshold for a binary classification model.
options.D: To calculate the difference between the true positive rate and the false positive rate.

question: Cohen’s Kappa is primarily used to:

options.A: Identify the most common words used in a piece of text.
options.B: Assess the agreement between two raters on a categorical scale.
options.C: Calculate the probability of a specific event occurring.
options.D: Determine the optimal number of sentences to include in an essay.

question: Automated Essay Scoring (AES) systems utilize Natural Language Processing (NLP) techniques. Which of the following is a common NLP technique used in AES systems?

options.B: Tokenization – breaking text into individual words.

question: What is a key advantage of using machine learning in Automated Essay Scoring compared to rule-based systems?

options.A: Rule-based systems are always more accurate.
options.B: Machine learning systems can automatically adapt to the nuances of writing and learn from data.
options.C: Rule-based systems are simpler to implement.
options.D: Machine learning systems require no training data.

question: Why is assessing inter-rater reliability crucial in validating Automated Essay Scoring systems?

options.A: It’s primarily used to measure the accuracy of the scoring algorithm.
options.B: It ensures the system’s scores consistently align with human graders, indicating its trustworthiness.
options.C: It focuses solely on the lexical diversity of the essays.
options.D: It’s only necessary if the system is used for large-scale assessments.
